title: Rayleigh Instructs the Straw Hats at Grove 17
description: At Grove 17, Rayleigh meets with Nami, Robin, Franky, Chopper, and Usopp on the Thousand Sunny. He informs them that Luffy has arrived on the island and teaches Nami how to operate a coated ship, instructing her to move the ship to Grove 42 to wait for the full crew assembly.
significance: Sets up the crew's reunion point and demonstrates that Rayleigh has successfully completed the ship coating for their journey to Fish-Man Island.

title: Marines Attack the Pirates at Grove 46
description: At Grove 46, where numerous pirates have gathered following Fake Luffy's recruitment call, Marines arrive to arrest them all. A battle breaks out between the assembled pirates and Marine forces.
significance: Creates the chaotic situation that will expose the Fake Straw Hat Crew and set up the demonstration of the real Straw Hats' new powers.

title: Caribou's Numa Numa no Mi Debut
description: When Fake Luffy orders Caribou to use a captured Marine as a shield, Caribou instead kills the Marine scout. A Marine attempts to attack Caribou with a sword but fails, revealing that Caribou possesses a Logia Devil Fruit - the Numa Numa no Mi (Swamp-Swamp Fruit). He uses his swamp powers to smother and shoot the Marine.
significance: First Logia-type Devil Fruit and first new Devil Fruit revealed after the two-year timeskip, establishing Caribou as a dangerous pirate despite his later comedic portrayal.

quotes.text: I'm a Logia-type Devil Fruit user!
quotes.speaker: Caribou
quotes.context: Caribou reveals his Devil Fruit powers while attacking Marines

title: Sentomaru and Pacifistas Arrive
description: Just as the battle seems to favor the Fake Straw Hats and allied pirates, Sentomaru arrives with two Pacifista units (PX-5 and PX-7). His arrival immediately terrifies the assembled pirates who remember the power of these cyborg weapons from two years ago.
significance: Reintroduces Sentomaru and the Pacifistas, setting up the contrast between how difficult they were to defeat two years ago versus the ease with which the Straw Hats will defeat them now.

title: Sentomaru Exposes Fake Luffy as Demaro Black
description: Fake Luffy collides with Sentomaru and begins bragging about being Luffy, claiming to be Dragon's son, Garp's grandson, a participant in the War of the Best, and having a 400 million berry bounty. Sentomaru cuts him off by smashing him with the broadside of his axe, declaring that Luffy is not trash like him. He then orders PX-5 to scan and identify the impostor, revealing him to be 'Three-Tongued' Demaro Black with a bounty of only 26 million berries.
significance: Exposes the Fake Straw Hat Crew deception and sets up the appearance of the real Luffy. Demonstrates the massive gap between Luffy's actual reputation and the impostor's true standing.

quotes.text: Luffy ain't a piece of trash like you!
quotes.speaker: Sentomaru
quotes.context: Sentomaru rebukes Fake Luffy before exposing his true identity

quotes.text: Target identified: Three-Tongued Demaro Black, bounty 26,000,000 berries.
quotes.speaker: PX-5
quotes.context: The Pacifista reveals Fake Luffy's true identity

title: Real Luffy's Identity Revealed at Sabaody
description: As PX-5 begins its attack, the real Luffy's disguise falls away, revealing his identity to the shocked crowd. Everyone present, including Sentomaru and the Marines, is stunned to see the actual Monkey D. Luffy standing before them at Grove 46.
significance: Marks the official return of Luffy to the world stage after two years, setting up his demonstration of newfound power. This is the moment the world learns that Luffy has returned and is ready for the New World.

title: Luffy vs PX-5 Battle Begins
description: PX-5 is ordered by Sentomaru to attack Luffy. The Pacifista fires three laser beams from its mouth at Luffy, but Luffy effortlessly dodges all attacks. The crowd watches in amazement as Luffy avoids the Pacifista's assaults with ease.
significance: Demonstrates immediately that Luffy's speed and observation capabilities have dramatically improved during the timeskip. Sets up his decisive victory.

title: Luffy Uses Haki-Enhanced Gear Second to Destroy PX-5
description: Luffy activates Gear Second and combines it with Armament Haki, his arm turning black with the coating. With a single Haki-enhanced punch (Gomu Gomu no Jet Pistol), Luffy completely destroys PX-5, shattering the Pacifista that took the entire crew's combined efforts to damage two years ago. The assembled pirates and Marines watch in absolute shock.
significance: First demonstration of Luffy's post-timeskip Haki abilities in combat. Dramatically illustrates the level of power the Straw Hats have achieved during their training. This single moment proves that Luffy is now ready for the New World and establishes the new power scale for the post-timeskip era.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy uses his Haki-enhanced attack to destroy PX-5 in one hit

title: Zoro and Sanji Encounter PX-7
description: As Luffy runs from Grove 46, he encounters Zoro and Sanji. At the same time, PX-7 appears and targets them. Instead of showing fear like they did two years ago, both Zoro and Sanji remain completely calm and confident.
significance: Sets up the demonstration that it's not just Luffy who has grown stronger - the entire crew has achieved dramatic power increases.

title: Zoro and Sanji Defeat PX-7 Together
description: Zoro and Sanji team up to battle PX-7. Zoro uses a powerful sword technique while Sanji activates his Diable Jambe (though the flames aren't shown hitting PX-7 in the anime). Together, they completely destroy the Pacifista with ease, demonstrating their post-timeskip strength.
significance: Confirms that all the Straw Hat fighters have achieved similar power growth during the timeskip. Pacifistas, which were nearly unbeatable threats two years ago, are now easily defeated by individual crew members.

title: The Straw Hats Run Together Toward the Sunny
description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji run together through Sabaody Archipelago toward the Thousand Sunny and their waiting crewmates. The three of them move in sync, showcasing their reunion and readiness to set sail for the New World.
significance: Symbolic moment showing the Monster Trio reunited and moving forward together. Represents the crew's return to action as a unified force.

title: Luffy Thanks Rayleigh and Reaffirms His Dream
description: As they run toward the ship, Luffy stops momentarily because he senses Rayleigh nearby. He turns and shouts his gratitude to Rayleigh for everything he did during the past two years of training. He then loudly declares that he will definitely become the Pirate King. Rayleigh watches with a smile, with tears in his eyes (in the manga).
significance: Emotional payoff to Rayleigh's training arc. Demonstrates Luffy's growth not just in power but in gratitude and determination. Rayleigh's response shows his faith in Luffy's potential to achieve his dream.

quotes.text: Thank you for everything, Rayleigh! I'm definitely going to become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's final declaration to Rayleigh before departing for the New World
